definition: mother-of-pearl (used in ornamentation and in TCM)

sentences.english: Those belonging to the wealthy were often richly inlaid with mother of pearl.
sentences.chinese: 那些有钱人家穿的通常会奢华的镶上珍珠母。

sentences.english: Only the mother-of-pearl and plastic buttons are bought.
sentences.chinese: 唯一珍珠母和塑料按钮被买。

sentences.english: Zhen zhu mu (shells) are being used as zhen zhu (pearls) clinically.
sentences.chinese: 临床上常以珍珠母代替珍珠使用。
大大小小的珠母贝纽扣。

sentences.english: This paper reports the results of cytotoxicity test of pearls of Pinctada martensii in vitro.
sentences.chinese: 本文报道了合浦珠母贝珍珠的体外细胞毒性试验结果。

sentences.english: In Europe and China, mother-of-pearl has been used as an inlay material for decorating furniture.
sentences.chinese: 在欧洲和中国，珠母经常用作装饰家具的镶嵌材料。

sentences.english: Mother-of-pearl, metal, or ceramics are other types of button for Mens suit.
sentences.chinese: 珍珠母，金属，陶瓷也是西装纽扣的一些类型。

definition: abbr. for Bengbu prefecture-level city 蚌埠市[Beng4 bu4 shi4], Anhui
red coral/precious coral (Corallium rubrum and several related species of marine coral)
shell/conch/cowry/mother of pearl/hard outer skin/also pr. [bei4 qiao4]
